page.title: 03FELL RUNNING IN LAMPLUGH
page.content: There are two fell races in Lamplugh, The Copeland Chase and The Blake Fell Race. They both start at the Pack of Hounds, Lamplugh. The Blake Fell Race is seven and a half miles with 2300 feet of climbing. Fell running is a race over steep hilly country. For a short race you would go straight up and down a fell. For a long race you would go up a few fells. Fells are what you call hills or mountains. Fell running started in Lakeland, at first they were professional races and you won money. Younger people started coming and trophies and medals were awarded. The amateur races started in the 1960's. More runners came and fell running became very popular. It can get very lonely up on the fells. To enter a long distance fell race in Cumbria in 1985 you have to be over eighteen.
